intro: Pseudohamelia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy pseudohamelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months.
